::::checkDownloadConfigParallel { dutList filenameList args }

##################################################################################################################### proc : checkDownloadConfigParallel input : dutList The dutList must be provided in ascending order e.g. {1 2 3} or {1 2 3 4 5} filenameList {dut1cfg dut2cfg dut3cfg} N O T E : Put the files on the tftp server WITHOUT the .xsf extension description: For the given number of duts, uploads/downloads the config to save time does this in parallel #####################################################################################################################

::::MultiTask

proc  ::::MultiTask { procList {result 0} }
############################################################### Procedure Name: MultiTask Description: This procedure is used to execute more than one test case simultaneoulsy by creating separate process for each procedure and execute them. Assumptions ----------- 1. All the test cases use telnet connection with the DUT to execute the CLI commands. No test script should use console connection to send CLI commands to DUT 2. Test cases which involves rebooting the DUT, downloading the configuration, etc should not be combined 3. Since all the test cases are executed simultaneously, user should takecare not to use the confliting configurations. For example two test cases should not try to use the same IXIA port Input Variables: procList - List of procedures that needs to be executed simultaneously Optional Args: None Output Variables: None Return Variables: None Possible Usage: lappend procList "1.1.1_2" lappend procList "5.4.10" lappend procList "snmp_test" MultiTask $procList ##############################################################
Defined in:
multiTask.tcl, line 39
